unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Statistical Significance at Various $\alpha$ Levels
question_text: In a hypothesis test for a population mean, results were found to be statistically significant at the $\alpha = 0.02$ level. Which of the following statements would also be true about the results of this test?

choices.text: The results would be statistically significant at the α = 0.01 α = 0.01 level.
The p-value obtained for this test was p = 0.02 p = 0.02 .
The results would be statistically significant at the α = 0.05 α = 0.05 level.
Since the results were statistically significant at the α = 0.02 α = 0.02 level, we have sufficient evidence to prove that our null hypothesis was false.
A mistake was made in considering the results to be statistically significant.  We can only consider our results to be statistically significant if α > 0.05 α > 0.05 .
